intro: Taprobanea spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed taprobanea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important species. The plant is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
